ArticleTitle.sentence: Cytomegalovirus immediate early genes upregulate interleukin-6 gene expression.

event.clue: Cytomegalovirus immediate early genes upregulate interleukin-6 gene expression.
Cytomegalovirus immediate early genes upregulate interleukin-6 gene expression.

AbstractText.sentence: BACKGROUND: The immediate early genes (IE) of human cytomegalovirus (CMV) can be expressed in monocytic cells and are known to regulate viral and cellular genes.

event.clue: BACKGROUND: The immediate early genes (IE) of human cytomegalovirus (CMV) can be expressed in monocytic cells and are known to regulate viral and cellular genes.

AbstractText.sentence: Interleukin-6 (IL-6) plays a central role in numerous inflammatory and immune processes.

event.clue: Interleukin-6 (IL-6) plays a central role in numerous inflammatory and immune processes.

AbstractText.sentence: Interleukin-6 levels are increased in lung transplant patients clinically diagnosed with CMV pneumonitis.

event.clue: Interleukin-6 levels are increased in lung transplant patients clinically diagnosed with CMV pneumonitis.

AbstractText.sentence: The regulation of IL-6 is dependent on various stimuli that include lipopolysaccharide (LPS), viruses, and other cytokines.

AbstractText.sentence: These studies examined the ability of CMV IE gene products to modulate IL-6 production.

event.clue: These studies examined the ability of CMV IE gene products to modulate IL-6 production.

AbstractText.sentence: METHODS: THP-1 cells, a monocytic cell line, were transfected with the CMV IE genes.

event.clue: METHODS: THP-1 cells, a monocytic cell line, were transfected with the CMV IE genes.
METHODS: THP-1 cells, a monocytic cell line, were transfected with the CMV IE genes.

AbstractText.sentence: Interleukin-6 protein and IL-6 mRNA were measured in control and CMV immediate early transfected cells.
Cotransfection of CMV IE genes and IL-6 chloramphenicol acetyl transferase (CAT) or IL-6 luciferase constructs were used to study IL-6 promoter activity.
RESULTS: Interleukin-6 protein and mRNA production were significantly increased in cells transfected with the CMV IE genes and stimulated with LPS compared to LPS-stimulated control cells.

event.clue: RESULTS: Interleukin-6 protein and mRNA production were significantly increased in cells transfected with the CMV IE genes and stimulated with LPS compared to LPS-stimulated control cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Cytomegalovirus IE gene products significantly enhanced LPS stimulation of IL-6 promoter activity in both IL-6 CAT and IL-6 luciferase assays.

event.clue: Cytomegalovirus IE gene products significantly enhanced LPS stimulation of IL-6 promoter activity in both IL-6 CAT and IL-6 luciferase assays.

AbstractText.sentence: A deletion construct that contains a NF-kappa B site but is missing the multiple response region demonstrated a continued increase in IL-6 luciferase activity in LPS-stimulated CMV transfected cells.

AbstractText.sentence: CONCLUSION: Cytomegalovirus immediate early gene products significantly enhanced expression of IL-6 in LPS-stimulated cells.

event.clue: CONCLUSION: Cytomegalovirus immediate early gene products significantly enhanced expression of IL-6 in LPS-stimulated cells.
CONCLUSION: Cytomegalovirus immediate early gene products significantly enhanced expression of IL-6 in LPS-stimulated cells.

AbstractText.sentence: The increase in IL-6 luciferase activity occurs in the absence of the multiple response region, the area of the IL-6 promoter responsive to IL-1, TNF alpha, cyclic amp, and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate.
